subject: Re: [junit] Same tests with varying initialization?
msgSnippet: On Mon, 23 Apr 2001, Daniel Aborg wrote: [snip] ... I just define a setup2() method that creates the additional fixture and call it from test methods that need
messageBody:
On Mon, 23 Apr 2001, Daniel Aborg wrote:

[snip]
> Basically, I'll have a TestCase which has a number of test methods and a
> common fixture, and after a while it often happens that I want to add an
> "additional" fixture against which all the test methods are /also/ run.
> Is there any common practice for handling this in the JUnit framework?

I just define a setup2() method that creates the additional fixture
and call it from test methods that need the extra fixture.

--
Joi Ellis Software Engineer
Aravox Technologies joi@..., gyles19@...

No matter what we think of Linux versus FreeBSD, etc., the one thing I
really like about Linux is that it has Microsoft worried. Anything
that kicks a monopoly in the pants has got to be good for something.
- Chris Johnson
